content.text: What's your stance on serverless compute?

It is decent protyping but the lack of observability and control is a non-starter in my case professionally. I prefer to have full control over my infrastructure. That side a serverless compute platform like AWS Fargate is very interesting because no call stat problem. Just completed managed infrastructure.
What are your favorite tools for software development?

I love to modify my shell config to suite my needs. This often through many shell functions which are aliases to shorthand commands that make sense to me. I also love using the unix operating system, a graphical db interfacing tool along with Postman.
What is your process for changes to move through the SDLC?

Everything is gitopd'd so the source code state dictates the state of the infrastructure. This is done through a series of pull requests and code reviews. Once the code is merged into the main branch, the CI/CD pipeline takes over and deploys the changes to the dev environment after testing anc creating the image. When a release tag is created and another CI job is kicked of to create a package which is published to our private registry, automates a commit, then creates the image, pushes it to all late stage sdlc envs and production and deploys to staging.
